description: From Middle French imbécile, from Latin imbēcillus (“weak, feeble”), literally “without a staff”.

adjectives.description: imbecile (comparative more imbecile, superlative most imbecile)

entries.meaning: (dated) Destitute of strength, whether of body or mind; feeble; impotent; especially, mentally weak.
examples: hospitals for the imbecile and insane

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A person with limited mental capacity who can perform tasks and think only like a young child, in medical circles meaning a person who lacks the capacity to develop beyond the mental age of a normal five to seven-year-old child.
